creator.name: Portugees Israelitische gemeente in Suriname
creator.his_func: The Dutch Portuguese Jewish congregation in Suriname was established in 1661/1662. It followed the habits and customs of the congregation of Amsterdam. The congregation in Suriname called itself "Bechara ve Shalom" (B.V.S., Blessing and Peace). A new prayer house was built in Paramaribo in the mid-18th century. It was called "Sedek ve Shalom" (S.V.S., Justice and Peace). The Mahamad acted as the church executive board and, until 1825, as a council for minor cases.
